text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Ishigami was born in Shizuoka Prefecture on November 4, 1957. After graduating from Shizuoka Technical High School, he joined Prefectural Leagues club Yamaha Motors in 1976. The club was promoted to Regional Leagues in 1977 and Japan Soccer League in 1979. The club won the Japan Soccer League champions in 1987/88. The club also won 1982 Emperor's Cup. He retired in 1990. He was selected Best Eleven 2 times. On September 30, 1984, Ishigami debuted for the Japan national team against South Korea. He played at 1986 World Cup qualification and 1986 Asian Games.
